headline: Slow Cooker Pot Roast
description: An easy slow cooker pot roast recipe that comes together quickly with the help of convenient packaged mixes for delicious flavor and tender beef.

video.description: See how to make a super simple, tender pot roast in the crock pot.
video.name: Slow Cooker Pot Roast

name: Slow Cooker Pot Roast
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (1.2 ounce) package dry beef gravy mix
1 (.7 ounce) package dry Italian-style salad dressing mix

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the inside of a slow cooker with cooking spray. Spread onion slices in the bottom of the cooker.

Pat roast dry and sprinkle all over with salt and pepper. Spread flour onto a work surface and roll roast in flour to coat all sides, using your hands or a small sturdy plate to pound flour into the meat. Place floured roast into the slow cooker on top of onions.
Whisk together beef gravy mix, ranch dressing mix, and Italian dressing mix in a bowl, then add water and whisk until smooth. Pour over roast. Distribute carrots around the meat.
Cover the slow cooker, set to Low, and cook until roast is tender and gravy has thickened, about 8 hours.

review.reviewBody: This was excellent! Lots of flavor. By far the BEST roast I’ve ever made! My family loved it!
Best pot roast my husband said he has ever had. I cut the cook time by 2 hours and it was still in a good place.

All the chemicals and salt from the gravy & dressing mixes totally not necessary. I just used some extra herbs: 2 tsp thyme, a few dashes of celery seed & a few cloves of garlic, plus an extra onion on top. Also instead of water, used 1/4 cup red wine and 1/4 cup chicken stock. Used 2 tbsp of cassava flour and a tbsp of arrowroot powder instead of flour. Seriously. Let's stop cooking with processed chemicals. It's actually quite easy.
Easy to prepare, outcome is tender & delicious.
I followed the recipe to a t. The carrots were not cooked after 8 hours on low, the roast was over cooked.
Love this recipe as is. Reliable and delicious. It is also very easy to modify.
The packets gave it a great flavor! Especially the Italian dressing which gave the meat a tasty zing!
I've made this Slow cooker pot Roast for my family several times and they absolutely LOVE it. Thank you for the Delicious recipe.❤❤❤❤❤
This is super good and simple and fast to prep. The only things I've tweaked is a sear my roast before putting it in the slow cooker. I also throw in a bay leaf or 2
Good, easy roast with nice gravy. I started on high for a few hours, then turned to low, and it turned out perfect.
Fantastic dinner! I've made this many times for friends and family and everyone loves it!

Made this recipe exact expect cut baby red potatoes in 1/2 and tossed them on top of gravy mixing it up a little! It was amazing, I have to make this again but with more potatoes and veggies. The gravy is amazing!!
This is by far the best roast that I have ever made! It's so simple even a single man can make a delicious meal.
delish
I've made this several times and followed the recipe exactly. My family LOVES this!! Thanks for sharing.

Very very good. Very easy. I read the reviews and decided to basically follow the recipe. Using gravy mix makes sense but I was curious about the Italian dressing mix and the ranch dressing mix. I use ranch dressing mix all the time in potato casseroles but I wasn’t sure about using it in pot roast. The 3 mixes worked perfectly together. I used 1 cup of water and I added red potatoes, celery, baby carrots and pearl onions. Magnificent!

OK, I made this tonight and followed the recipe, adding only cut-up russet potatoes and half a jar of medium roasted peppers I had on hand. Here's the kicker: I'm out of town and the only pot roast my local butcher had was dry-aged.First, the gravy was velvet smooth, the peppers added a great kick...but the meat! They say your meal is only as good as the ingredients, and of course that's true. But if you ever get a chance to make this meal with a dry-aged pot roast, jump at that chance.This meal is now in the rotation. My husband is licking the plate like he's never seen food. Off to stop him...

I followed the recipe pretty exact except for 1 minor change....I used onion soup mix instead of the gravy mix because it was all I had on hand. This was very fall apart tender. I myself found it to be a tad bit to salty myself but hubby loved it.

Really very good and easy. A few changes: added some potatoes and celery and reduced the carrots. also did not have beef gravy mix but had some (long in the tooth) slow cooker sloppy joe mix which I used in place of. I did not add salt (forgot) and my saltaholic wife loved it without adding any at the table. I will be making it again next month and hopefully will remember to buy some beef gravy mix.
Best pot roast I have ever made! My husband loved it so much I had to make it twice in a week!

This recipe was simple yet tasty. I added potatoes and garlic. I can understand why some thought this was overly salty. I think adding the potatoes and a bit more water helped the cut out some of the saltiness. Surely a keeper in my book!

My family and I loved this recipe. It is simple to make which is great for a busy family. I poured the mixture over the entire chuck roast instead of how they did it in the video where they poured it around it. My chuck which was close to 3 pounds took up the whole bottom of my crockpot. I would like the gravy to be thicker so I may adjust the mixture next time. Still good all the same
I've been making this recipe for years. BEST tasting gravy!!! Didn't change a thing!

When I saw the ingredients I immediately thought of how salty this would be with all the powdered ingredients (ranch dressing/beef/salad dressing and my intuition was right. This was over the top salty. I made it exactly as written and took the advice on the video and used beef broth instead of water when mixing the powdered ingredients. Sorry this is a loser in my book.

Finally a pot roast i was proud of and enjoyed. I did the salt and pepper followed by massaging flour into the meat. Then placed it in an empty crock pot . I made the season mixture and covered the meat. I let it sit overnight in the fridge. The next morning I cut up onions,carrots, celery, and red potatoes. Tossed them in and cooked on low for 8 hours.

I couldn't believe how good this is!! I didn't have 8 hours, and my roast was 3lbs. I added some beef broth and cooked on high 2.5hrs, then flipped the roast and cooked another 3.5hrs. Seriously, the best tasting roast and so tender. So simple, so good

This was a good kickstarter for my first time making a roast. But it DEFINITELY needs at least 12 hours on low and I agree that it was a little salty. Didn't really care for the flavor. I believe it was the Italian mix that was over the top. Maybe next time experiment with the gravy and another spice or 2. Goes well with mashed potatoes/ even instant potatoes!

This was one of the best out roasts I’ve ever eaten! I was a little skeptical about this recipe due to the three different packets, but everything came together so well. If you don’t normally use a lot of salt, I would suggest cutting the amount of flavoring packets uses or adding more liquid.
Amazing! Diced the carrots up and threw them in the slow cooker, goes great with mashed potatoes on the side.

I’ve made this over 10 times. I can’t cook and this has impressed myself and my family. So delicious! Making it again tomorrow. Only negative is always deciding wether to eat with rice or mashed potatoes. Excellent either way!!!

I did not use Flour and I also did not make the gravy. I used beef broth and Onion dip mix in the broth, 1 beer and 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar to break down the meat. I also got an iron skillet really hot and seared the chuck roast on all sides 4 minutes then put it in the pot and cooked. I feel like it was even more tender but had some nice crispy bits too.

I did have ranch dressing but made my own Italian dressing , didn’t have gravy mix and didn’t roll the meat in flour first- 
And it was STILL DELICIOUS!! Super tasty!! I ate leftovers a week later as sandwiches.. 
no need for any other Pot Roast recipe at this point…
Wow! I didn’t have the packets of salad dressing and gravy, so I made home

One of my go to recipes. I had all of the ingredients one day to make this, not realizing I was out of brown gravy mix. I used worchestire instead of the gravy mix and water. Came out maybe even better than the original recipe that I already love.

My family loves this! It’s so good. We make it all the time. I do increase the water to 3/4 cup to get more gravy and l only add 1/2 a small onion since I don’t like onions too much. Also I add a few red potatoes. Serve over rice. Yum! Thank you for sharing!

I made this last night and I only have one complaint. I wish I had gotten a bigger roast!!! This was DELICIOUS!!! I followed the recipe as is but I added a container of sliced baby Bella mushrooms. I served it over mashed potatoes with sliced French bread. It all went in minutes! I had some gravy left over so I saved it for the leftover mashed potatoes. Mmmm.

I made this and I left out the flour and the ranch I used a bag of the sliced carrots onion and the small yellow potatoes I used the gravy and Italian dressing pack also cooked for 8 hours low the 1st 4 hours was just the roast the last for was with the potatoes and carrots my family ate it all

What a simple and great recipe! I added Yukon Gold potatoes under the meat. The carrots and potatoes were done perfectly as was the chuck roast. And the gravy?? Totally awesome! I saved what gravy was left and put it in the freezer. It will be great on any other kind of meat or meatloaf. Will make this again for sure!
I love how it made a gravy with the juices and seasonings. Taste great and will do it again.
Everyone loved it!! I did it in the oven at 325* for about 3 hours. It was amazing.
Followed the recipe only change was adding green beans and baby carrots in pot under the roast. It tasted good but was It was very salty.
this came out awesome and was so easy. I also cut up 5 potatoes and added them with the carrots.
Sooo good! Very easy. I’m still learning slow cook recipes and this is going on our menu. Added potatoes.

This is seriously the best pot roast i have ever made. My husband said the gravy was the best he has ever tasted and I agree. Didnt change a thing... and wouldn't change a thing... perfect! thanks so much!!

Delicious! Followed the recipe 90% but I followed some tips from other reviewers and did the following:
I seasoned the roast with fresh cracked black pepper, eliminating the salt. Then floured and browned it in a little oil. I placed a few carrots and new potatoes in the crockpot then added the roast and placed a bay leaf on top. Chopped the onion (added a little minced garlic too) and lightly caramelized them in the same pan I browned the roast. Added to the crockpot with roast. Mixed the seasoning packets to together adding 2 Tbls of flour then whisked in 1/2 c red wine and 1/4 c water. Poured over the roast. Cooked on Low for 6 hrs, then added baby carrots and new potatoes. Cooked another 2 1/2 hours on Low till carrots were tender. The roast was falling apart. No knife needed. And OMG the gravy is out of this world!
Absolutely delicious! The only thing I did differently was to add 1 cup of water because I wanted more gravy and I added russett potatoes and mushrooms. Not too salty like some reviews said.
Great recipe! My family loved it. Thanks for sharing.

Excellent recipe. Took longer than 15 minutes to prep as I added potatoes, extra chunked onions (in addition to the sliced onions on the bottom of the crockpot), peeled baby carrots, and bella mushrooms. It took me 30 minutes to prep. I used two packets of gravy. The brand I used was Pioneer. It says that each packet makes 2 cups of gravy. I thought. "No way, that's going to be enough gravy for me!" Plus, with the extra vegetables, I knew that there would be more liquid than the recipe called for. Made for a very tasty dinner.
So good! My family devoured it, wasn't even any leftovers!

This was such a home run! It was so delicious and the package mixes were perfect. I added 1/4 cup of beef stock and it was too salty for our taste, so I added 1/4 cup of water and it was just right. I added 2 cubed potatoes and 7 carrots, and all were cooked to perfection. My only concern was that the gravy might be too thin, but the flour pressed into the beef did the trick. Great recipe and so very easy.

It was delicious!!! No need for any additional salt; just added some pepper, Worcester sauce and potatoes. I used a 4 lb. eye round roast as I don’t care for chuck and I had one in the freezer. Also, after flouring the roast, I browned it on top of the stove before putting it in the slow cooker. Everyone raved about the flavor. Gravy was the perfect consistency!!!
Insanely good!!! Followed exactly and added potatoes. Made cornbread, slice tomatoes and cucumbers with it. Definitely a keeper!!!

Delicious! I used brown gravy mix because I couldn't find any "beef gravy" mix. I spent so much time looking for the beef gravy that I forgot to get the ranch packet so I just used a couple of squirts of liquid ranch dressing instead. I added 3 diced potatoes on top before pouring the gravy mixture over it. This was so yummy!!! Definitely will be my go to pot roast recipe!!!

This is my go to pot roast. Only changes I make is whole garlic in slots of meat and I use red wine instead of water. We’re Italian. Lol make sure you use carrots even if you don’t like them it absorbs the sodium from the packaged seasoning. It’s delicious!! My husband always smiles when he sees that I’m making this.

This was delicious. I’m seeing a new picture with the recipe that is now showing celery and potatoes. That would be a great addition. When I reheated the leftovers I added peas and fresh mushrooms. Awesome. So my take away is add anything you like and it will be amazing. Definitely will make again. Once everything is in the pot there is absolutely nothing else to do. If you want to make rolls to sop up the gravy my husband wouldn’t argue. Try it, you’ll love it.

A good recipe that makes more gravy than you’d expect! Tastes even better the next day, so makes great left-overs too. After making a couple of times, I changed the water to beef broth and added a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce to deepen the flavor. Also, once when I did t have Italian dressing mix, I used a packet of garlic-herb dip mix and it still came out great, so i think you can improvise with what you have on hand and not spend $$ on special ingredients.
Change absolutely nothing!!! Fantastic in every way. The flavors, gravy, beef is spot on.
Best roast I've ever made. Delicious!

The best pot roast ever! My husband raved and raved about it. I used chicken broth instead of water and added small red potatoes. Also left out the flour. Didn't need it. Cooked on low 6 hours in my crockpot and it was perfect!

I made this yesterday and I gotta say it was the best pot roast I ever had. Sorry Mom. I added a pound of quartered red potatoes. And substituted half a cup of red wine (Cabernet Sauvignon) in the gravy mix, til desired consistency was reached. I had my doubts about the amount of liquid when the cooking started. But about halfway (4 hours) into cooking the gravy had completely covered the roast, and was eventually more than enough. I waited the 8 hours and when it was done, the meat was so tender it stirred right into the mix like magic!! My four year old daughter gives it 2 thumbs way up!! And that is impressive for a pot roast. Til next review, stay grubbin my friends!!!!
This is now our go-to pot roast. We love the flavor and that the gravy is ready when the roast is done. I worried it would be too many spices with 3 different packets, but it’s delicious.
This recipe is perfect and delicious as is! I wouldn't change a thing! A stick to your ribs meal, for sure! My husband and I will be making over and over again!
followed recipe exactly and it came out perfect!
The best Pot Roast I was so impressed with the flavor and the gravy.

Following the directions, this recipe is bland. It also doesn’t call for nearly enough water. I’m glad I checked mine because the onions were burning. I added about 1 tbs of soy sauce and woreschire sauce and a 1 tsp of garlic powder and white pepper. I also added lots of salt and pepper. It ended up okay. Wouldn’t attempt this again.
This is definitely the best pot roast recipe I’ve ever made. Even my picky son loved it. I’m making it again tonight!
I made exactly as written. Hands down the best pot roast I have ever had! The gravy is delicious. This will definitely be my go to pot roast recipe.

It's actually easy to make and turned out super delicious. 

Ive got no idea how to cook; I just followed the instructions and watched video.
Turned out well! I doubled all ingredients to include the beef. Came out juicy, flavorful and tender. Made it and loved it!

This was delicious! I bought a spicy ranch packet by mistake, so the veggies I added (potatoes, carrots, onions, mushrooms, celery pieces) had quite a kick! Thankfully the meat didn’t take on that spicy flavor. I’ll be more careful next time, and there will be a next time! Thank you for the recipe!
Excellent.

Seared the roast (just salt and pepper) and then put into the slow cooker after the base of onions and celery and a cup of red wine. Added carrots, potatoes, fresh thyme, couple bay leaves, and the packets as directed. Used about 3/4 cup of water. Best ever!
This was so so good. I didn’t have beef gravy so I used brown gravy, also I didn’t have the Italian dressing so I just used ranch and brown gravy and it turned out fine.

This was Blue Ribbon pot roast! The meat cut easily with a fork and was moist. I coated the meat with salt and pepper and browned the outside. I also added baby carrots and celery to the crock pot. I didn't think the various mixes would turn out such a scrumptious gravy. Highly recommend!

Wow, this was delicious! Like beef stew, I've always found pot roast to be very bland (I've tried various recipes), but this is hands down the best pot roast I've ever had. I also added sliced baby portabellas and omitted the potatoes because I didn't have any on hand, instead, I served it on egg noodles. Also, I followed others' suggestions on here and halved the ranch and gravy packets (and maybe used 3/4 of the Italian dressing mix) so it wouldn't be unbearably salty. It's definitely a dish I'll make again and again.
The best slow cooker pot roast I’ve ever had! I didn’t have the package of Italian dressing seasoning so I added a splash of bottled Italian dressing. Served with mashed potatoes! Delicious!
Best pot roast I ever made! Tender and tasty. I added small potatoes.
I used a full can of a bitter Ale and it still turned out great.
This was absolutely delicious I added one thing only and that was a few little peppercinces for just a little more spicy

I was very skeptical about the seasoning packets, but this proved to be a delicious dish,... and hubby approved for a pot roast, which is a rarity.

I like a lot of veggies, so added carrots, onions, celery, and potatoes, and cooked in the instant pot.

The flavor is great! I was skeptical about the sodium content based on other reviews.. but I added the recommended carrots and onion and waited until an hour and a half until time was up to add mushrooms.. made mashed potatoes.. everything was on track. The only problem is that this pot roast has been in the slow cooker since 8am. It's now 4:40pm (so 8 hours and 40 minutes) and it still isn't done. We used a 2.5 lb roast, I followed the instructions exactly. Super frustrating. Flavor is on point, but cooking time is not.

I heaped diced potatoes on top, and added about an extra cup of water to make sure those cooked as well. It was amazingly tender- I was able to serve it with just a spoon. My husband loved it, even though the idea of pot roast hadn’t sounded good to him. My two year old ate it up too!
Winner! Added 2 tablespoons worsteshire, one shallot sliced, chopped potato, and 1 pkg Lipton mushroom onion soup mix.

This is hands down my favorite recipe. The meat is so tender and it has amazing flavor. Everyone I have ever made his for, asks for this recipe. I do add a ton of veggies to the pot and used a dry red wine to mix with the seasoning.

Delicious. I was unsure of the different salad mixes, but that worked well. I tenderized the beef first and infused it with garlic and onion powder and a little salt and pepper. I let it sit in the mixture as well while I did the rest of the preparation before putting it into the slow cooker. I’ve not had a lot of success with my slow cooker, but it came out amazing - and I’m not a fan of pot roast. My husband lived it. I served it with red mashed potatoes and corn bread.
I have made this recipe six times didn’t change a thing loved it

Amazing! I floured and browned it in a cast iron skillet before putting it in the crock pot and did half wine/half water in the gravy mix. Served over a bed of red mashed potatoes!! Definitely the best recipe!
Our go to roast recipe! I add potatoes too and it’s delicious!
Easy to make, and very delicious! Thanks for this recipe!

"This is the best pot roast I've ever had," my happy boyfriend said while eating this for dinner. Like other reviewers said, the dressing mixes really give the meat/gravy amazing flavor. I poured some red cooking with over the onions, and also mixed the dressing powders with 3/4 cup water. Great gravy consistency!

This was the best pot roast I have ever had!! (Don’t tell my dad) I had to add potatoes and also increased the water to 1 cup like everyone else! I also added a splash of red wine!! The gravy turned out perfectly thick! I used a angus beef tenderloin roast and it was perfect! Also I had a little trouble finding the Italian dressing seasoning packet at my grocery store! I finally found it but had to buy one that included a glass serving cup/ mixer for dressings! I can see myself making my own Italian dressing seasoning in the future! Glad I picked it up though because this recipe was amazing!

I made this, DO NOT SALT THE MEAT, I WOULD ALSO TRY TO FIND A LOW SODIUM GRAVY, DRESSING & RANCH DIP. If not, it will be too salty. Cook as directed, best pot roast ever. I do not put potatoes in the crock pot, for me, it's a texture thing. Crock pot potatoes are gross. Make mashed on the side. Add a splash of red cooking wine, and wochestershire. You won't be sorry, the gravy is amazing on mashed potatoes.
I wasn’t sure about the dressings and gravy mixes but yum! This was a great dinner with mashed potatoes! Thank you for sharing!

I made this EXACTLY as written and it was good, but we could definitely taste the Italian dressing and it left the gravy a bit too "zippy". I'm going to keep this recipe and absolutely make it again, but next time I'll only use a half packet at most of the Italian dressing. I'll also add some celery and a few sprigs of rosemary. Aaaand I'll probably sear the roast. Great and easy recipe, and after those few minor adjustments it should be exactly perfect for our tastes.
Turned out really well! I added 2-3 russet potatoes, which I think really added to the recipe.
Delicious! The only change I made was using regular Italian dressing vs dry because I couldn’t find any in the store. I served it over mashed potatoes, kids and hubby loved it!

I had such high hopes for this recipe after seeing all of the awesome reviews. I followed the directions exactly and I'm sorry to say that I didn't like it at all. The flavor was so not pot roast. I had put it into my favorite list, due to the great reviews, but have since removed it after trying it myself. I won't be making it again.
Great seasoning, great recipe! It turned out super yummy, I did add potatoes to it.
It was good, but still a slow cooker meal. Husband said it was better then all others.
